results.title: The Impossible
results.creator_credit: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, ICAA, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.headline_credit: Spain and United States of America, 2012
results.brief_description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand only for the devastating Indian Ocean tsunami to strike.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, ICAA, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand. But the day after Christmas, the idyllic holiday turns into an incomprehensible nightmare when a terrifying roar rises from the depths of the sea, followed by a wall of black water that devours everything in its path. Though Maria and her family face their darkest hour, unexpected displays of kindness and courage ameliorate their terror.
description_for_label: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand. But the day after Christmas, the idyllic holiday turns into an incomprehensible nightmare when a terrifying roar rises from the depths of the sea, followed by a wall of black water that devours everything in its path. Though Maria and her family face their darkest hour, unexpected displays of kindness and courage ameliorate their terror.

results.title: The Imitation Game
results.creator_credit: Bristol Automotive, Black Bear Pictures, Maria Djurkovic, Sammy Sheldon, Morten Tyldum, Graham Moore, Teddy Schwarzman, Nora Grossman, Ido Ostrowsky, The Weinstein Company and Peter Heslop
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Based on the real life story of legendary cryptanalyst Alan Turing, the film portrays the nail-biting race against time by Turing and his brilliant team of code-breakers at Britain’s top-secret Government Code and Cypher School at Bletchley Park, during the darkest days of World War II.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bristol Automotive, Black Bear Pictures, Maria Djurkovic, Sammy Sheldon, Morten Tyldum, Graham Moore, Teddy Schwarzman, Nora Grossman, Ido Ostrowsky, The Weinstein Company and Peter Heslop

results.title: The Home Song Stories
results.creator_credit: Spark Script Workshop, Film Finance, Film Victoria, MediaCorp Raintree Pictures, SBS Independent, Fortissimo Films, Big & Little Films Pty. Ltd., Porchlight Films, ScreenWest, Lotterywest, Australian Film Board, New South Wales Film & Television Office, Cappi Ireland, Michael McMahon, Liz Watts, Melinda Doring and Tony Ayres
results.brief_description: Tom, now in his 40s, begins to write the memoirs of his 1960s childhood, as the little boy whose mother Rose was a glamorous Shanghai nightclub singer who met an Australian sailor and moved the family to Melbourne.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Spark Script Workshop, Film Finance, Film Victoria, MediaCorp Raintree Pictures, SBS Independent, Fortissimo Films, Big & Little Films Pty. Ltd., Porchlight Films, ScreenWest, Lotterywest, Australian Film Board, New South Wales Film & Television Office, Cappi Ireland, Michael McMahon, Liz Watts, Melinda Doring and Tony Ayres
results.description: Tom, now in his 40s, begins to write the memoirs of his 1960s childhood, as the little boy whose mother Rose was a glamorous Shanghai nightclub singer. When Rose meets Aussie sailor Bill, they are quickly married, and she packs up Tom and his older sister May to head for Melbourne. The marriage just as quickly breaks up and Rose moves with the kids to Sydney. After a succession of male friends and little success, in 1971 Rose moves back to Melbourne, in an uncomfortable arrangement living again with Bill – and his mother. With Bill called away to sea, Rose takes up with young Chinese cook Joe, but despair and conflicts over May’s relationship with Joe tear the family further apart. Little Tom is deeply hurt, but May’s ongoing conflict with her mother takes a respite when Rose tells her daughter about her traumatic teenage years.
description_for_label: Tom, now in his 40s, begins to write the memoirs of his 1960s childhood, as the little boy whose mother Rose was a glamorous Shanghai nightclub singer. When Rose meets Aussie sailor Bill, they are quickly married, and she packs up Tom and his older sister May to head for Melbourne. The marriage just as quickly breaks up and Rose moves with the kids to Sydney. After a succession of male friends and little success, in 1971 Rose moves back to Melbourne, in an uncomfortable arrangement living again with Bill – and his mother. With Bill called away to sea, Rose takes up with young Chinese cook Joe, but despair and conflicts over May’s relationship with Joe tear the family further apart. Little Tom is deeply hurt, but May’s ongoing conflict with her mother takes a respite when Rose tells her daughter about her traumatic teenage years.

results.title: The Haunted Barn
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring, E.A. Dietrich-Derrick and Gregan McMahon
results.brief_description: John Moon is a businessman interested in ghosts. He decides to spend the night in a barn hoping to see the ghost of the bushranger Sturdy who died there when betrayed to the police by his friend Rogan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.W. Thring, E.A. Dietrich-Derrick and Gregan McMahon

results.title: The Hate U Give
results.brief_description: Raised in a poverty-stricken slum, a 16-year-old girl named Starr now attends a suburban prep school. After she witnesses a police officer shoot her unarmed best friend, she’s torn between her two very different worlds as she tries to speak her truth.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: Raised in a poverty-stricken slum, a 16-year-old girl named Starr now attends a suburban prep school. After she witnesses a police officer shoot her unarmed best friend, she’s torn between her two very different worlds as she tries to speak her truth.

results.title: The Gleaners and I
results.brief_description: Varda focuses her eye on gleaners: those who scour already-reaped fields for the odd potato or turnip. Her investigation leads from forgotten corners of the French countryside to off-hours at the green markets of Paris, following those who insist on finding a use for that which society has cast off, whether out of necessity or activism.
results.description: Varda focuses her eye on gleaners: those who scour already-reaped fields for the odd potato or turnip. results.title: The Girl on the Train
results.creator_credit: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.headline_credit: India and United States of America, 2016
results.brief_description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor

results.title: The Games
results.brief_description: The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.description:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.
description_for_label:
The Games was an Australian mockumentary television series about the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. The series was originally broadcast on the ABC and had two seasons of 13 episodes each, the first in 1998 and the second in 2000.

‘The Games’ starred satirists John Clarke and Bryan Dawe along with Australian comedian Gina Riley and actor Nicholas Bell. It was written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson. The series centred on the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and satirised corruption and cronyism in the Olympic movement, bureaucratic ineptness in the New South Wales public service, and unethical behaviour within politics and the media. An unusual feature of the show was that the characters shared the same name as the actors who played them, to enhance the illusion of a documentary on the Sydney Games.

results.title: The Frog Prince
results.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
description_for_label: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955: others include The Gallant Little Tailor, Hänsel and Gretel, Sleeping Beauty and Snow White and Rose Red.
